author: ryanleeschneider
content: I'm a little unclear on the format of the `access_list` in 2930, is it supposed to be in RLP format (e.g.`rlp([[addr1,[key1a,key1b]],[addr2,[key2a]]])`) or just the data binary packed together (`addr1 || key1a || key2a || addr2 || key2a`)?  My assumption has been RLP encoded but I don't see that fully spelled out.  I'm happy to provide a PR clarifying either way once I'm sure which it should be.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Awesome I'll try to come up with a PR with wording that makes that more obvious.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Actually one more question: the overall `access_list` can be empty, but can the list of storage keys?  That is to say,  is `rlp([[addr1, [] ]])` a valid storage list?  If not I think the grammar needs to be further clarified since the "zero or more" implies an empty list is acceptable.

author: 0xraino
content: Sure since you don't need any storage slots if you just need to update the balance of an account.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: oh wait the example actually shows the 2nd one as empty ðŸ™‚

author: ryanleeschneider
content: ok cool, got it!  The fact that the lists can be empty kind of forces RLP encoding vs binary packing, since the binary packed format could be ambiguous.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Hopefully last question: for EIP-2930/1559, would one expect the `v` field in the JSON response for say `eth_getTransactionByHash` to be of the form `0x0|0x1` or continue to be in the EIP-155 `chainId * 2 + 35 + y` format?  My vote/inclination is for 0x0 or 0x1, but am also a little unclear on the history of why it was `27 + 0|1` before EIP-155.

author: lightclient
content: <@!388751025789468672> yeah should be 0x0 or 0x1 -- 27 comes some ECC in old implementations (https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/83035/how-to-determine-first-byte-recovery-id-for-signatures-message-signing)

author: draganrakita
content: for `v` we have both `v` and `standardV` field even for legacy transaction
